intro: Gonolobus tetragonus, commonly known as the four-angled goonie, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough, hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
